Your local forecast office is

Hot temperatures returning to the Southwest

After a brief reprieve, the southwestern U.S. will heat up again on Sunday and last for several days. Temperatures will be 10 to 15 degrees above normal in some locations, with daytime highs reaching 100 degrees in parts of the Inland Empire of southern California, and reaching 100-115 degrees in the deserts of Calif., Nevada and Arizona.
Read More...

Detailed Forecast

Tonight
Clear, with a low around 32. North northwest wind around 6 mph becoming light and variable.
Sunday
Sunny, with a high near 76. Light and variable wind becoming west southwest 6 to 11 mph in the afternoon.
Sunday Night
Clear, with a low around 37. West wind 5 to 9 mph becoming light and variable after midnight.
Monday
Sunny, with a high near 81. Light and variable wind becoming west southwest 5 to 8 mph in the morning.
Monday Night
Partly cloudy, with a low around 42. West wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm.
Tuesday
Mostly sunny, with a high near 83. South southeast wind 5 to 11 mph becoming west in the afternoon.
Tuesday Night
Mostly clear, with a low around 43. North wind 5 to 7 mph.
Wednesday
Mostly sunny, with a high near 81.
Wednesday Night
Partly cloudy, with a low around 45.
Thursday
A 20 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms after noon. Mostly sunny, with a high near 79.
Thursday Night
A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly cloudy, with a low around 45.
Friday
A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly sunny, with a high near 78.
Friday Night
A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly cloudy, with a low around 46.
Saturday
A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly sunny, with a high near 79.
